issue.title: [CF 697] More options for Custom Texture choices
issue.body:
The Custom Texture feature is awesome and lets me do some really creative things with my icon indicators (for example, I created a custom .TGA which is completely transparent and use it to make complex layered text layouts via TMW Text Displays).

Here are some ideas to make it even more robust:

1. Allow some way to specify a custom texture per spell in lists that are monitoring multiple auras, spells, etc.

For example it could have a syntax like:

BuffNameA(tex:Inv_Misc_Lingerie_02), BuffNameB

So Buff A would display with a custom texture, while Buff B would display with its default texture (or perhaps the global Custom Texture for that icon) since it had nothing specified.

2. Allow the "Custom texture" slot to take a variable input. It could have many uses, but my initial motivation here is that I want the texture for an icon to display whatever is equipped in Slot 17 of my character sheet.


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star | Imported from CurseForge issue #697 | Raw

comments.body:
1) Not possible without a huge resign of how this setting works that would require substantial changes to existing icon types. The closest thing to this that could ever happen is a global, addon-wide setting that would replace one specific texture for all icons with some other specific texture.

2) I could see this happening.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@ #1: Ah, OK. Well it's not a big deal, like I said the Custom Texture feature is already awesome to have as it is.

I only brought the idea up because I get bothered every once in a while when Blizz does weird things like give the "Atonement" Combat Event heal effect the icon for Circle of Healing, instead of just using the Atonement skill icon.

Then I get it confused with Circle of Healing procs from other people in the raid. Blah. >.<


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star
